document_title: Blepharitis on the eyes: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Upper blepharitis is not a dangerous disease, but if not detected and treated promptly, it will cause many complications and affect daily life.
Eyelash loss
Upper blepharitis causes eyelashes to fall out, lose color or grow abnormally (misaligned eyelashes).
Eye scars
If upper blepharitis is left for a long time, it will form scars on the eyelid or next to the eyelid.
Excessive tearing or dry eyes
Abnormal tear flow prevents the eyes from moisturizing, leading to dry eyes.
Phony eye
A stye is an infection that develops near the base of an eyelash or on the eyelid, forming a papilloma that causes pain and discomfort.
Patchwork eyes
Upper blepharitis causes small oil glands at the edge of the eyelid to become clogged, causing blepharitis with swelling and redness.
Conjunctivitis
Upper blepharitis can lead to recurring episodes of pink eye, also known as conjunctivitis.
Corneal infection
Upper blepharitis causes eye irritation, misaligned eyelashes or dry eyes, thereby increasing the risk of corneal infection.
Master Doctor Pham Huy Vu Tung, Ophthalmology specialist, Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City
